title: Fact Check: Don’t fall for this morphed picture of Sambit Patra sketching RaGa’s portrait | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
A picture of BJP spokesperson, Sambit Patra has surfaced on the internet in which he can be seen sketching a portrait of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on a piece of paper.

ALSO READ: PM Modi did not meet Home Minister Amit Shah in hospital;…

NewsMobile fact checked the above post and found the picture to be FAKE.

On putting the picture through a simple Reverse Image Search, we found the original picture which was tweeted by Patra himself.

The picture was tweeted by Sambit Patra on August 1, 2020, marking the 100th death anniversary of Bal Gangadhar Tilak. In the original picture, he can be seen sketching Bal Gangadhar Tilak’s portrait.

In the above FAKE vs REAL collage, it is clear that the Bal Gangadhar Tilak’s sketch was replaced by Rahul Gandhi’s using photo editing software to create a false narrative. Moreover, we can also notice that the portrait of PM Modi on the wall in the FAKE picture was also superimposed.

In conclusion, the above information proves that the picture in question is FAKE.
